Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: JustAnotherTraveler2
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here for a night. Great stay! Very reasonable price. The room was big and comfy. Amazing shower! So much character. The breakfast (included) was amazing with a variety of juices, homemade yogurt, breads, meats, etc. A great atmosphere overall. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They kept our bags after check-out to let us explore Berlin. The location was great!! Hotel is within walking distance to Zoo Garten train station and major shopping. I highly recommend this hotel. We booked a room with our own private toilet and shower. They have other cheaper options. When in Berlin, I will always stay at this hotel. What a great find!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and near the Ku'damm”
Reviews.Author: Roy C
Reviews.Content: The room was very quiet and comfortable and the entire staff was friendly and helpful. They were also happy to speak English, which certainly helped us as our German skills are shaky at best. The ideal location is just a few steps away from the fabulous Kurfürstendamm and also a U-bahn stop. For the price, I doubt that there is a better hotel along the Ku’damm. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: SydneyErin
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful hosts, safe & quirky. We have stayed here many times over the past decade. I'm sad to see this business suffer due to the development of the new central station HBH. Make the effort to go back to ZOO station & 5 min. walk-you will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: barry060
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Berlin for the first time in December to enjoy the city's Christmas markets. We booked the Hotel Pension Columbus, conveniently situated in the centre of the city. What a find!. Warm, clean, fascinating building ( the rooms had ceiling heights of 4.2 metres!),built in the early 1900's and retaining many original features. We enjoyed the warm hospitality of the owners who gave us lots of good advice on where and what to visit. Breakfast was excellent and our room spotless. This hotel is a real gem and I would recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: CasaRoscoe
Reviews.Content: The hallway is dim, the floors creak, the towels don't match, no two rooms have the same furniture. WHAT A GREAT PLACE! This our second time here and another family member has stayed here annually for the past 7-8 years. Hotel Pension Columbus is a true family pension, run with great care and dedication. The 19 rooms are all different - some with bathrooms, some without. All have very high ceilings and hark back to an earlier Berlin. Breakfast is a treat and, with a selection of magazines and the daily paper auf Deutsch, one could linger in the breakfast room for an hour. Chris and her husband run a wonderful place. They are truly helpful and cheerfully dole out suggestions for dinner, shopping and transportation. They react flexibly to client needs. They will offer a traveller a much more interesting accommodation experience than one could ever get in a hotel. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: WKH57
Reviews.Content: We (couple with two adult sons 21&18) were on an extended winter holiday through Europe and we stayed three nights and loved this place. It is really well located with plenty of restaurant, shopping and transport options close by. Chris is an amazingly friendly host and her breakfasts were fantastic - all that you could want to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Less impressed than last time, but still reasonably happy.”
Reviews.Author: ElephantFeeder
Reviews.Content: I've reviewed this hotel before, having been quite happy with it when I was travelling alone. This time around, I was travelling with my fiancée. My first interaction with the hotel was the morning before our arrival, when I called to advise that we may be cancelling at the last minute, due to my fiancée possibly not being able to fly. The woman on the other end (one of the owners, I believe) was very sympathetic and told me not to worry -- if I had to cancel at the last minute due to illness, we would not be charged for our room. Win! On our arrival, we were quite disappointed by the fact that our room, which on the booking website was listed as a "double room", had two single beds at opposite ends of the room. When we asked about alternatives, we were told that no rooms with double beds were available. The beds in this room were also a bit on the uncomfortable side, and the heating in the room was ineffective. The latter problem was solved by extra blankets, which were immediately provided upon request. Having arrived in Berlin from a week with relatives who live without an internet connection, we were keen to get online. As on my previous visit to this hotel, I found the WiFi coverage to be spotty at best. There was no coverage at all in our room, nor was there in the few places in the corridor where seating was available. To check our email, we had to stand in the corridor, about six rooms down from ours. And, even then, the connection went in and out. As on my previous stay, breakfast was excellent and plentiful. The female owner (again, I'm assuming she's an owner -- my understanding is that the hotel is run by a couple) not only put on a delicious spread, but was also very friendly and helpful in providing suggestions and directions for sightseeing. On the whole, I was still quite happy with the hotel, especially for the money. My fiancée does not want to return, on account of her uncomfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “A loving home away from home”
Reviews.Author: NielsBSDk
Reviews.Content: The place to be in Berlin. Extremely friendly host - we loved staying there for 4 nights. The rooms are nice and clean - no noise on a charming small street right next to the Kurfurstendam. The breakfirst was great - eggs, ham chease fruit and all one could ask for. We could make a lunchbag for the trip home.. we felt like in heaven and there are many angels in pension Columbus. We would stay there again any time and we will never forget the owner - a warm and cozy place - go there!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Petegrancan
Reviews.Content: Didn’t realise the hotel was part of an old building which shared its access with businesses etc but after initial reservations it didn’t prove to be a problem. In fact, it was one of the quietest hotels we have stayed in. Service is/was second to none. The owners and staff are so friendly, efficient and very helpful! Room sizes differ greatly, we had a large double with plenty of space. Our friend, who had stayed there before, had a reasonably sized single. Breakfast was typically German, lots of choice and enjoyed trying new tastes and textures. Free WiFi was offered, a definite plus for travellers. Very handily situated for everything central and beyond. Naturally we would recommend the Columbus.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly service, and a comfortable bed in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ElephantFeeder
Reviews.Content: I got to this hotel after a long day of sightseeing, with sore feet and a sore back. The hotel is close to a subway station, only one stop away from the Zoological Gardens, in West Berlin. I was a little confused when I arrived, as I had to ring a doorbell at what looked somewhat like an apartment building. This is more of a reflection on my inexperience than the hotel, but I thought it might be worth mentioning, for others like me, who end up going to the Hotel Pension Columbus and start to worry when they don't encounter a lobby :-) Once my initial confusion passed, and I got upstairs to the third floor, I received a very warm welcome. I was first shown the room I had booked -- one without a shower (shared bathroom facilities on the floor) -- but was then offered, at no additional charge, a room with a shower (WC still shared, across the corridor). I accepted the better room, of course. The gentleman (sorry, I can't remember his name) was very friendly, and answered the many questions I had. He also suggested a very nice Thai restaurant (called Lychee) nearby, which was perfect for a vegetarian student who was travelling on a tight budget. The room itself was quite simple, but everything was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. When I got up in the morning, I was greeted, and asked what I would like to eat and drink, before I made it to the breakfast room. Breakfast was both delicious and plentiful. Having remembered that I had asked for a recommendation for a vegetarian dinner the night before, the owners went to the trouble of preparing a cheese plate for me, in lieu of meat options. I thought this was a very nice touch. All in all, I thought this hotel was great. The only problem I had was that I was unable to connect to the free wifi, both with my laptop and my phone. Not a big deal, but slightly annoying. Still, I would happily go back to this hotel if I ever go back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jtaylorx
Reviews.Content: I took my retired parents here last week on their first trip to Berlin. We all loved the Columbus. The rooms are basic - but extremely clean - and very reasonably priced for a central West Berlin area. The couple who own it speak very good English and are full of recommendations to make the most of your stay. Breakfast is terrific. Thanks to the Koenigs again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hospitality”
Reviews.Author: OldCodgerSomerset
Reviews.Content: In Berlin for our first visit and to watch our son run in the Berlin Marathon, we arrived late and very tired after all-day train travel from Calais (having had to use the ferry as our Eurostar train had been cancelled, due a fire in the Channel Tunnel) and we were welcomed like old friends. The hotel is on the 3rd floor of a beautiful 1906 building, one of the few remaining after WW2, when 80% of Berlin was flattened; what's more, apart from the addition of an elevator, the building remains unaltered and retains all original features and rooms; no partitioning through cornices and windows here! And it's right in the heart of the city, with easy transport access, with 3 good restaurants/bars practically adjacent to the hotel - yet all bedrooms are totally quiet, as they overlook inner squares. My wife was initially unimpressed to find that, although a shower had been added in one corner of the room, the lavatory was across the corridor, as not all rooms have en-suite facilities. Nor was she impressed with the mishmash of 50's & 60's furniture, although the exceptional cleanliness of everything pleased and mollified her. At breakfast next day, in a lovely room overlooking the street (also oddly, but cleanly furnished) we were delighted by the food and the hospitality, which never waned for a moment throughout our 4 day stay. Nothing was too much trouble and the lovely couple who own and run the hotel could not have been kinder. At breakfast on the 3rd day our hostess presented us with a tray on which were 2 champagne flutes, a small bottle of bubbly, and a candle - with profuse apologies that she had not noticed from the registration card that it had been my birthday the day before!! Unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there twice now, and soon a third!”
Reviews.Author: HenknAnnie
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Hotel Pension Columbus in August 1999. We had arrived at 6am on the boat train from Sweden, crammed in a 6-berth sleeper cabin and arrived at the Zoogarten station totally whacked. We chose the Columbus from a display of accommodation in the area as it looked like it once was a grand residence and it was only 500m from the station. The room rate, including breakfast was then only DM125 ($AUD100) including as much as you can eat continental breakfast for 2. A very quiet hotel, we slept for the first 12 hours! Stayed 1 week and loved it. The second time we stayed here was in September 2005, again for a week, using it as a base for further exploring Berlin. The room rate was then 90 Euro ($AUD147) a day, a modest increase in tariff considering many other places just replaced the DM sign with a Euro sign!. The hotel is run by a wife and husband team who still remembered us from 5 years earlier! Breakfast is still as good and the establishment is spotless! A few words about the facilities; There is a lift to the hotel which is on the third floor and you are given two keys: one to get into the lobby and one for your room. Security plus! The rooms all have a handbasin; showering and toilet facilities are one per passageway (never bothered us, at home we don't have a bathroom in our bedroom either!) There may be "superior" rooms that have built-in facilities. The rooms are large by hotel standards and are equipped with TV, (maybe a phone also; we used our mobile phone, so didn't notice), good solid furniture and comfortable bed(s). See the posted photo for our room (our second stay; the room we had in 1999 was quite a bit larger again). Anything you need (such as champagne kept cold in the hotel's kitchen fridge) - just ask. Our hosts also provided information on things to see and do, with a local touch! Within 300m are some famous landmarks (the Kaiser Wilhelm gedachtnis kirche), Hard Rock Cafe, bus tours, eateries and yes, an erotic museum. In short, to us it was like a home away from home! Most other guests were of similar age (40-60) and very polite. Speaking to them at breakfast indicated many were "return" clients. We certainly will be again!
